geneVariantDescriptions.description: ERBB2 (HER2) amplification indicates an increased number of copies of the ERBB2 (HER2) gene. However, the mechanism causing the increase is unspecified.

references.title: External Reference Not Available (N/A)

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, increased copy number (CN) of ERBB2 (HER2) was associated with improved response to Poziotinib (HM781-36B) treatment in patients with Erbb2 (Her2)-positive breast cancer, with a median progression-free survival of 4.86 months in patients with CN over 8 and 2.99 months in patients with CN equal to or less than 8 (HR=0.61, p=0.037) (PMID: 30720867, NCT02418689).

references.title: Molecular alterations and poziotinib efficacy, a pan-HER inhibitor, in human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)-positive breast cancers: Combined exploratory biomarker analysis from a phase II clinical trial of poziotinib for refractory HER2-positive breast cancer patients.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination of Herceptin (trastuzumab) and Tykerb (lapatinib) treatment induced tumor regression in ERBB2 (HER2)-amplified cell line xenograft models of gastric cancer (PMID: 26296355).

references.title: Sustained Inhibition of HER3 and EGFR Is Necessary to Induce Regression of HER2-Amplified Gastrointestinal Carcinomas.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination of Erbitux (cetuximab) and Tykerb (lapatinib) induced tumor regression in patient-derived xenograft (PDX) models of colorectal cancer with ERBB2 (HER2) amplification (PMID: 22586653).

references.title: A molecularly annotated platform of patient-derived xenografts ("xenopatients") identifies HER2 as an effective therapeutic target in cetuximab-resistant colorectal cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Vizimpro (dacomitinib) was more effective in preventing proliferation in ERBB2 (HER2) amplified breast cancer cells than in wild-type ERBB2 (HER2) breast cancer cells (PMID: 22761403).

references.title: Dacomitinib (PF-00299804), an irreversible Pan-HER inhibitor, inhibits proliferation of HER2-amplified breast cancer cell lines resistant to trastuzumab and lapatinib.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, a uterine serous carcinoma cell line harboring ERBB2 (HER2) amplification demonstrated sensitivity to treatment with Taselisib (GDC-0032) in culture, resulting in inhibition of cell growth (PMID: 26333383).

references.title: Dual HER2/PIK3CA Targeting Overcomes Single-Agent Acquired Resistance in HER2-Amplified Uterine Serous Carcinoma Cell Lines In Vitro and In Vivo.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial (MyPathway), Herceptin (trastuzumab) and Perjeta (pertuzumab) combination treatment resulted in objective response in 33% (3/9, 1 complete response, 1 partial response) and stable disease lasting over 120 days in 22% (2/9) of patients with bladder cancer harboring ERBB2 (HER2) amplification or overexpression (PMID: 29320312; NCT02091141).

references.title: Targeted Therapy for Advanced Solid Tumors on the Basis of Molecular Profiles: Results From MyPathway, an Open-Label, Phase IIa Multiple Basket Study.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with Tykerb (lapatinib) resulted in initial disease stabilization with subsequent progression, in patient-derived colorectal cancer tumorgraft models with ERBB2 (HER2) amplification (PMID: 26296355).

references.title: Sustained Inhibition of HER3 and EGFR Is Necessary to Induce Regression of HER2-Amplified Gastrointestinal Carcinomas.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase III (NALA) trial that supported FDA approval, combination of Nerlynx (neratinib) and Xeloda (capecitabine) reduced risk of disease progression or death (HR=0.76, p=0.006), improved 12-month PFS (28.8%, 88/307 vs 14.8%, 46/314) compared to lapatinib and capecitabine combination in patients with metastatic ERBB2 (HER2)-positive (amp/over exp) breast cancer who had 2 or more prior ERBB2 (HER2)-targeted therapies (J Clin Oncol 37, no. 15_suppl (May 20, 2019) 1002-1002; NCT01808573).

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II (MATCH) trial, Kadcyla (trastuzumab emtansine) treatment resulted in partial response in 8.1% (3/37) and stable disease in 43% (16/37) of patients with ERBB2 (HER2) amplified non-breast, non-gastric advanced solid tumors, with a 6-month progression-free survival rate of 24.8% (J Clin Oncol 36, 2018 (suppl; abstr 100); NCT02465060).

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, a patient with duodenal adenocarcinoma harboring ERBB2 (HER2) amplification demonstrated a complete pathologic response after treatment with a combination of Herceptin (trastuzumab), Adrucil (fluorouracil), Wellcovorin (leucovorin), and Eloxatin (oxaliplatin) (PMID: 28784859).

references.title: Neoadjuvant Treatment With Trastuzumab and FOLFOX Induces a Complete Pathologic Response in a Metastatic ERBB2 (HER2)-Amplified Duodenal Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Gilotrif (afatinib) inhibited proliferation and induced cell-cycle arrest and apoptosis of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) cell lines with ERBB2 (HER2) amplification in culture, and inhibited tumor growth in ERBB2 (HER2)-amplified NSCLC cell line xenograft models (PMID: 26545934).

references.title: Antitumor effect of afatinib, as a human epidermal growth factor receptor 2-targeted therapy, in lung cancers harboring HER2 oncogene alterations.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a retrospective analysis, patients with metastatic KRAS exon 2 wild-type colorectal cancer harboring ERBB2 (HER2) amplification or overexpression (n=79) demonstrated poorer objective response rate (31.2 vs 46.9, p=0.031) and progression-free survival (5.7 vs 7 months, p=0.087) to anti-EGFR treatment (Vectibix (panitumumab) or Erbitux (cetuximab), as monotherapy or combined with chemotherapy) when compared to ERBB2 (HER2)-negative patients (n=113) (PMID: 30952821).

references.title: HER2 Positivity Predicts Unresponsiveness to EGFR-Targeted Treatment in Metastatic Colorectal Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical study, ERBB2 (HER2) amplification was associated with resistance to Erbitux (cetuximab) in colorectal cancer patients (PMID: 21900593).

references.title: Activation of ERBB2 signaling causes resistance to the EGFR-directed therapeutic antibody cetuximab.

references.title: Dual HER2/PIK3CA Targeting Overcomes Single-Agent Acquired Resistance in HER2-Amplified Uterine Serous Carcinoma Cell Lines In Vitro and In Vivo.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II clinical trial, a gastric cancer patient with co-amplification of ERBB2 (HER2) and EGFR initially responded to treatment with Gilotrif (afatinib), but progressed at 16 weeks, and post-treatment tumor profiling of the progressing disease sites, the liver lesions, identified ERBB2 (HER2) amplification, PTEN P95R, and CCND3 amplification, but not EGFR amplification (PMID: 30463996; NCT30463996).

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, the presence of ERBB3 single nucleotide variants (SNVs) was associated with shorter progression-free survival (wild-type vs mutant, 3.75 vs 1.48 months, HR=1.59, p=0.176) in patients with metastatic Erbb2 (Her2)-positive (amplification or overexpression) breast cancer treated with Poziotinib (HM781-36B), and SNVs in the cytoplasmic domain correlated with further decreased response (1.38 vs 4.07 months, HR=4.58, p<0.001) (PMID: 30720867, NCT02418689).

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, Kadcyla (ado-trastuzumab emtansine) treatment resulted in clinical benefit after one cycle of treatment, and stable disease with regression at lung metastasis after 3 cycles of treatment in a patient with colorectal adenocarcinoma harboring ERBB2 (HER2) amplification and KRAS G12D (PMID: 32023524).
